column4: there are a few alarm clocks that work on media players as well

those two that I posted sanduhr and wmtimer, as well as things like xmms-alarm and bmp-alarm

yeah I noticed that on xfce too, it is sketchy. Luckily I keep the desktop clean so it doesn't matter.
so you cant save either to the desktop

I can save to the desktop, but it doesn't show up on the desktop, it does show up in thunar on the desktop and in the terminal on the desktop too. You can activate the desktop though, it just comes undone and is tiresome. Go to Applications>settings>desktop settings and allow xfce to manage desktop
./configure is you running the script, make come sin build-essential
that is already compiled, all you do is extract it and run the firefox script to launch firefox
